records.definition: fond of or characterized by joking; humorous or playful

records.examplesOfUsage: "the blow stung and she retaliated immediately"
records.definition: make an attack or assault in return for a similar attack

records.examplesOfUsage: "he was bored and cranky after eight hours of working"
"he is unwashed, uncouth, and drunk most of the time"
records.definition: (of a person or their appearance or behavior) lacking good manners, refinement, or grace
great energy or enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or an objective

records.examplesOfUsage: "Just as accepting gifts from strangers or bringing home found objects were regarded as dangerous, so too was lending, especially money or embers from the stove to rekindle a fire."

records.definition: (of a person or part of the body) abnormally formed; misshapen

records.examplesOfUsage: "Two figures lay sprawled on the Equestrian grass, talking and laughing merrily"
records.definition: sit, lie, or fall with one's arms and legs spread out in an ungainly or awkward way

records.examplesOfUsage: "...who’d ended up here through no mechanism he or anyone else had yet been able to discern..."
